trans-unit.source: How to monitor a cloud service | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to monitor a cloud service | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to monitor cloud services by using the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to monitor cloud services by using the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: How to Monitor Cloud Services
trans-unit.target: How to Monitor Cloud Services

trans-unit.source: You can monitor key performance metrics for your cloud services in the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can monitor key performance metrics for your cloud services in the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: You can set the level of monitoring to minimal and verbose for each service role, and can customize the monitoring displays.
trans-unit.target: You can set the level of monitoring to minimal and verbose for each service role, and can customize the monitoring displays.

trans-unit.source: Verbose monitoring data is stored in a storage account, which you can access outside the portal.
trans-unit.target: Verbose monitoring data is stored in a storage account, which you can access outside the portal.

trans-unit.source: Monitoring displays in the Management Portal are highly configurable.
trans-unit.target: Monitoring displays in the Management Portal are highly configurable.

trans-unit.source: You can choose the metrics you want to monitor in the metrics list on the Monitor page, and you can choose which metrics to plot in metrics charts on the Monitor page and the dashboard.
trans-unit.target: You can choose the metrics you want to monitor in the metrics list on the Monitor page, and you can choose which metrics to plot in metrics charts on the Monitor page and the dashboard.

trans-unit.source: Concepts
trans-unit.target: Concepts

trans-unit.source: By default, minimal monitoring is provided for a new cloud service using performance counters gathered from the host operating system for the roles instances (virtual machines).
trans-unit.target: By default, minimal monitoring is provided for a new cloud service using performance counters gathered from the host operating system for the roles instances (virtual machines).

trans-unit.source: The minimal metrics are limited to CPU Percentage, Data In, Data Out, Disk Read Throughput, and Disk Write Throughput.
trans-unit.target: The minimal metrics are limited to CPU Percentage, Data In, Data Out, Disk Read Throughput, and Disk Write Throughput.

trans-unit.source: By configuring verbose monitoring, you can receive additional metrics based on performance data within the virtual machines (role instances).
trans-unit.target: By configuring verbose monitoring, you can receive additional metrics based on performance data within the virtual machines (role instances).

trans-unit.source: The verbose metrics enable closer analysis of issues that occur during application operations.
trans-unit.target: The verbose metrics enable closer analysis of issues that occur during application operations.

trans-unit.source: By default performance counter data from role instances is sampled and transferred from the role instance at 3-minute intervals.
trans-unit.target: By default performance counter data from role instances is sampled and transferred from the role instance at 3-minute intervals.

trans-unit.source: When you enable verbose monitoring, the raw performance counter data is aggregated for each role instance and across role instances for each role at intervals of 5 minutes, 1 hour, and 12 hours.
trans-unit.target: When you enable verbose monitoring, the raw performance counter data is aggregated for each role instance and across role instances for each role at intervals of 5 minutes, 1 hour, and 12 hours.

trans-unit.source: The aggregated data is purged after 10 days.
trans-unit.target: The aggregated data is purged after 10 days.

trans-unit.source: After you enable verbose monitoring, the aggregated monitoring data is stored in tables in your storage account.
trans-unit.target: After you enable verbose monitoring, the aggregated monitoring data is stored in tables in your storage account.

trans-unit.source: To enable verbose monitoring for a role, you must configure a diagnostics connection string that links to the storage account.
trans-unit.target: To enable verbose monitoring for a role, you must configure a diagnostics connection string that links to the storage account.

trans-unit.source: You can use different storage accounts for different roles.
trans-unit.target: You can use different storage accounts for different roles.

trans-unit.source: Note that enabling verbose monitoring will increase your storage costs related to data storage, data transfer, and storage transactions.
trans-unit.target: Note that enabling verbose monitoring will increase your storage costs related to data storage, data transfer, and storage transactions.

trans-unit.source: Minimal monitoring does not require a storage account.
trans-unit.target: Minimal monitoring does not require a storage account.

trans-unit.source: The data for the metrics that are exposed at the minimal monitoring level are not stored in your storage account, even if you set the monitoring level to verbose.
trans-unit.target: The data for the metrics that are exposed at the minimal monitoring level are not stored in your storage account, even if you set the monitoring level to verbose.

trans-unit.source: How to: Configure monitoring for cloud services
trans-unit.target: How to: Configure monitoring for cloud services

trans-unit.source: Use the following procedures to configure verbose or minimal monitoring in the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Use the following procedures to configure verbose or minimal monitoring in the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Before you begin
trans-unit.target: Before you begin

trans-unit.source: Create a storage account to store the monitoring data.
trans-unit.target: Create a storage account to store the monitoring data.

trans-unit.source: You can use different storage accounts for different roles.
trans-unit.target: You can use different storage accounts for different roles.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see help for Storage Accounts, or see How To Create a Storage Account.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see help for Storage Accounts, or see How To Create a Storage Account.

trans-unit.source: Enable Azure Diagnostics for your cloud service roles.
trans-unit.target: Enable Azure Diagnostics for your cloud service roles.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Configuring Diagnostics for Cloud Services</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Configuring Diagnostics for Cloud Services</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the diagnostics connection string is present in the Role configuration.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the diagnostics connection string is present in the Role configuration.

trans-unit.source: You cannot turn on verbose monitoring until you enable Azure Diagnostics and include a diagnostics connection string in the Role configuration.
trans-unit.target: You cannot turn on verbose monitoring until you enable Azure Diagnostics and include a diagnostics connection string in the Role configuration.

trans-unit.source: Projects targeting Azure SDK 2.5 did not automatically include the diagnostics connection string in the project template.
trans-unit.target: Projects targeting Azure SDK 2.5 did not automatically include the diagnostics connection string in the project template.

trans-unit.source: For these projects you need to manually add the diagnostics connection string to the Role configuration.
trans-unit.target: For these projects you need to manually add the diagnostics connection string to the Role configuration.

trans-unit.source: To manually add diagnostics connection string to Role configuration
trans-unit.target: To manually add diagnostics connection string to Role configuration

trans-unit.source: Open the Cloud Service project in Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Open the Cloud Service project in Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: Double click on the Role to open the Role designer and select the Settings tab
trans-unit.target: Double click on the Role to open the Role designer and select the Settings tab

trans-unit.source: Look for a setting named Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Plugins.Diagnostics.ConnectionString.
trans-unit.target: Look for a setting named Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Plugins.Diagnostics.ConnectionString.

trans-unit.source: If this setting is not present then click on the Add Setting button to add it to the configuration and change the type for the new setting to ConnectionString
trans-unit.target: If this setting is not present then click on the Add Setting button to add it to the configuration and change the type for the new setting to ConnectionString

trans-unit.source: Set the value for connection string the by clicking on the ... button.
trans-unit.target: Set the value for connection string the by clicking on the ... button.

trans-unit.source: This will open up a dialog allowing you to select a storage account.
trans-unit.target: This will open up a dialog allowing you to select a storage account.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Visual Studio Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Visual Studio Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To change the monitoring level to verbose or minimal
trans-unit.target: To change the monitoring level to verbose or minimal

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, open the Configure page for the cloud service deployment.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, open the Configure page for the cloud service deployment.

trans-unit.source: In Level, click Verbose or Minimal.
trans-unit.target: In Level, click Verbose or Minimal.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: After you turn on verbose monitoring, you should start seeing the monitoring data in the Management Portal within the hour.
trans-unit.target: After you turn on verbose monitoring, you should start seeing the monitoring data in the Management Portal within the hour.

trans-unit.source: The raw performance counter data and aggregated monitoring data are stored in the storage account in tables qualified by the deployment ID for the roles.
trans-unit.target: The raw performance counter data and aggregated monitoring data are stored in the storage account in tables qualified by the deployment ID for the roles.

trans-unit.source: How to: Receive alerts for cloud service metrics
trans-unit.target: How to: Receive alerts for cloud service metrics

trans-unit.source: You can receive alerts based on your cloud service monitoring metrics.
trans-unit.target: You can receive alerts based on your cloud service monitoring metrics.

trans-unit.source: On the Management Services page of the Azure Management Portal, you can create a rule to trigger an alert when the metric you choose reaches a value that you specify.
trans-unit.target: On the Management Services page of the Azure Management Portal, you can create a rule to trigger an alert when the metric you choose reaches a value that you specify.

trans-unit.source: You can also choose to have email sent when the alert is triggered.
trans-unit.target: You can also choose to have email sent when the alert is triggered.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>How to: Receive Alert Notifications and Manage Alert Rules in Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>How to: Receive Alert Notifications and Manage Alert Rules in Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: How to: Add metrics to the metrics table
trans-unit.target: How to: Add metrics to the metrics table

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, open the Monitor page for the cloud service.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, open the Monitor page for the cloud service.

trans-unit.source: By default, the metrics table displays a subset of the available metrics.
trans-unit.target: By default, the metrics table displays a subset of the available metrics.

trans-unit.source: The illustration shows the default verbose metrics for a cloud service, which is limited to the Memory\Available MBytes performance counter, with data aggregated at the role level.
trans-unit.target: The illustration shows the default verbose metrics for a cloud service, which is limited to the Memory\Available MBytes performance counter, with data aggregated at the role level.

trans-unit.source: Use Add Metrics to select additional aggregate and role-level metrics to monitor in the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Use Add Metrics to select additional aggregate and role-level metrics to monitor in the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Verbose display</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Verbose display</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To add metrics to the metrics table:
trans-unit.target: To add metrics to the metrics table:

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: Click Add Metrics to open Choose Metrics, shown below.
trans-unit.target: Click Add Metrics to open Choose Metrics, shown below.

trans-unit.source: The first available metric is expanded to show options that are available.
trans-unit.target: The first available metric is expanded to show options that are available.

trans-unit.source: For each metric, the top option displays aggregated monitoring data for all roles.
trans-unit.target: For each metric, the top option displays aggregated monitoring data for all roles.

trans-unit.source: In addition, you can choose individual roles to display data for.
trans-unit.target: In addition, you can choose individual roles to display data for.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add metrics</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add metrics</linkText>

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: To select metrics to display:
trans-unit.target: To select metrics to display:

trans-unit.source: Click the down arrow by the metric to expand the monitoring options.
trans-unit.target: Click the down arrow by the metric to expand the monitoring options.

trans-unit.source: Select the check box for each monitoring option you want to display.
trans-unit.target: Select the check box for each monitoring option you want to display.

trans-unit.source: You can display up to 50 metrics in the metrics table.
trans-unit.target: You can display up to 50 metrics in the metrics table.

trans-unit.source: In verbose monitoring, the metrics list can contain dozens of metrics.
trans-unit.target: In verbose monitoring, the metrics list can contain dozens of metrics.

trans-unit.source: To display a scrollbar, hover over the right side of the dialog box.
trans-unit.target: To display a scrollbar, hover over the right side of the dialog box.

trans-unit.source: To filter the list, click the search icon, and enter text in the search box, as shown below.
trans-unit.target: To filter the list, click the search icon, and enter text in the search box, as shown below.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add metrics search</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add metrics search</linkText>

trans-unit.source: After you finish selecting metrics, click OK (checkmark).
trans-unit.target: After you finish selecting metrics, click OK (checkmark).

trans-unit.source: The selected metrics are added to the metrics table, as shown below.
trans-unit.target: The selected metrics are added to the metrics table, as shown below.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>monitor metrics</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>monitor metrics</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To delete a metric from the metrics table, click the metric to select it, and then click Delete Metric.
trans-unit.target: To delete a metric from the metrics table, click the metric to select it, and then click Delete Metric.

trans-unit.source: (You only see Delete Metric when you have a metric selected.)
trans-unit.target: (You only see Delete Metric when you have a metric selected.)

trans-unit.source: To add custom metrics to the metrics table
trans-unit.target: To add custom metrics to the metrics table

trans-unit.source: The Verbose monitoring level provides a list of default metrics that you can monitor on the portal.
trans-unit.target: The Verbose monitoring level provides a list of default metrics that you can monitor on the portal.

trans-unit.source: In addition to these you can monitor any custom metrics or performance counters defined by your application through the portal.
trans-unit.target: In addition to these you can monitor any custom metrics or performance counters defined by your application through the portal.

trans-unit.source: The following steps assume that you have turned on Verbose monitoring level and have configuring your application to collect and transfer custom performance counters.
trans-unit.target: The following steps assume that you have turned on Verbose monitoring level and have configuring your application to collect and transfer custom performance counters.

trans-unit.source: To display the custom performance counters in the portal you need to update the configuration in wad-control-container:
trans-unit.target: To display the custom performance counters in the portal you need to update the configuration in wad-control-container:

trans-unit.source: Open the wad-control-container blob in your diagnostics storage account.
trans-unit.target: Open the wad-control-container blob in your diagnostics storage account.

trans-unit.source: You can use Visual Studio or any other storage explorer to do this.
trans-unit.target: You can use Visual Studio or any other storage explorer to do this.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Visual Studio Server Explorer</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Visual Studio Server Explorer</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Navigate the blob path using the pattern DeploymentId/RoleName/RoleInstance to find the configuration for your role instance.
trans-unit.target: Navigate the blob path using the pattern DeploymentId/RoleName/RoleInstance to find the configuration for your role instance.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Visual Studio Storage Explorer</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Visual Studio Storage Explorer</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Download the configuration file for your role instance and update it to include any custom performance counters.
trans-unit.target: Download the configuration file for your role instance and update it to include any custom performance counters.

trans-unit.source: For example to monitor Disk Write Bytes/sec for the C drive add the following under PerformanceCounters\Subscriptions node
trans-unit.target: For example to monitor Disk Write Bytes/sec for the C drive add the following under PerformanceCounters\Subscriptions node

trans-unit.source: Save the changes and upload the configuration file back to the same location overwriting the existing file in the blob.
trans-unit.target: Save the changes and upload the configuration file back to the same location overwriting the existing file in the blob.

trans-unit.source: Toggle to Verbose mode in the management portal configuration.
trans-unit.target: Toggle to Verbose mode in the management portal configuration.

trans-unit.source: If you were in Verbose mode already you will have to toggle to minimal and back to verbose.
trans-unit.target: If you were in Verbose mode already you will have to toggle to minimal and back to verbose.

trans-unit.source: The custom performance counter will now be available in the Add Metrics dialog box.
trans-unit.target: The custom performance counter will now be available in the Add Metrics dialog box.

trans-unit.source: How to: Customize the metrics chart
trans-unit.target: How to: Customize the metrics chart

trans-unit.source: In the metrics table, select up to 6 metrics to plot on the metrics chart.
trans-unit.target: In the metrics table, select up to 6 metrics to plot on the metrics chart.

trans-unit.source: To select a metric, click the check box on its left side.
trans-unit.target: To select a metric, click the check box on its left side.

trans-unit.source: To remove a metric from the metrics chart, clear its check box in the metrics table.
trans-unit.target: To remove a metric from the metrics chart, clear its check box in the metrics table.

trans-unit.source: As you select metrics in the metrics table, the metrics are added to the metrics chart.
trans-unit.target: As you select metrics in the metrics table, the metrics are added to the metrics chart.

trans-unit.source: On a narrow display, an n more drop-down list contains metric headers that won't fit the display.
trans-unit.target: On a narrow display, an n more drop-down list contains metric headers that won't fit the display.

trans-unit.source: To switch between displaying relative values (final value only for each metric) and absolute values (Y axis displayed), select Relative or Absolute at the top of the chart.
trans-unit.target: To switch between displaying relative values (final value only for each metric) and absolute values (Y axis displayed), select Relative or Absolute at the top of the chart.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Relative or Absolute</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Relative or Absolute</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To change the time range the metrics chart displays, select 1 hour, 24 hours, or 7 days at the top of the chart.
trans-unit.target: To change the time range the metrics chart displays, select 1 hour, 24 hours, or 7 days at the top of the chart.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Monitor display period</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Monitor display period</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the dashboard metrics chart, the method for plotting metrics is different.
trans-unit.target: On the dashboard metrics chart, the method for plotting metrics is different.

trans-unit.source: A standard set of metrics is available, and metrics are added or removed by selecting the metric header.
trans-unit.target: A standard set of metrics is available, and metrics are added or removed by selecting the metric header.

trans-unit.source: To customize the metrics chart on the dashboard
trans-unit.target: To customize the metrics chart on the dashboard

trans-unit.source: Open the dashboard for the cloud service.
trans-unit.target: Open the dashboard for the cloud service.

trans-unit.source: Add or remove metrics from the chart:
trans-unit.target: Add or remove metrics from the chart:

trans-unit.source: To plot a new metric, select the check box for the metric in the chart headers.
trans-unit.target: To plot a new metric, select the check box for the metric in the chart headers.

trans-unit.source: On a narrow display, click the down arrow by *n*??metrics to plot a metric the chart header area can't display.
trans-unit.target: On a narrow display, click the down arrow by *n*??metrics to plot a metric the chart header area can't display.

trans-unit.source: To delete a metric that is plotted on the chart, clear the check box by its header.
trans-unit.target: To delete a metric that is plotted on the chart, clear the check box by its header.

trans-unit.source: Switch between Relative and Absolute displays.
trans-unit.target: Switch between Relative and Absolute displays.

trans-unit.source: Choose 1 hour, 24 hours, or 7 days of data to display.
trans-unit.target: Choose 1 hour, 24 hours, or 7 days of data to display.

trans-unit.source: How to: Access verbose monitoring data outside the Management Portal
trans-unit.target: How to: Access verbose monitoring data outside the Management Portal

trans-unit.source: Verbose monitoring data is stored in tables in the storage accounts that you specify for each role.
trans-unit.target: Verbose monitoring data is stored in tables in the storage accounts that you specify for each role.

trans-unit.source: For each cloud service deployment, six tables are created for the role.
trans-unit.target: For each cloud service deployment, six tables are created for the role.

trans-unit.source: Two tables are created for each (5 minutes, 1 hour, and 12 hours).
trans-unit.target: Two tables are created for each (5 minutes, 1 hour, and 12 hours).

trans-unit.source: One of these tables stores role-level aggregations; the other table stores aggregations for role instances.
trans-unit.target: One of these tables stores role-level aggregations; the other table stores aggregations for role instances.

trans-unit.source: The table names have the following format:
trans-unit.target: The table names have the following format:

trans-unit.source: where:
trans-unit.target: where:

trans-unit.source: deploymentID is the GUID assigned to the cloud service deployment
trans-unit.target: deploymentID is the GUID assigned to the cloud service deployment

trans-unit.source: aggregation_interval = 5M, 1H, or 12H
trans-unit.target: aggregation_interval = 5M, 1H, or 12H

trans-unit.source: role-level aggregations = R
trans-unit.target: role-level aggregations = R

trans-unit.source: aggregations for role instances = RI
trans-unit.target: aggregations for role instances = RI

trans-unit.source: For example, the following tables would store verbose monitoring data aggregated at 1-hour intervals:
trans-unit.target: For example, the following tables would store verbose monitoring data aggregated at 1-hour intervals:
